WorkItem.ClosedComment: Issue appears to be directly related to Issue 14344, closing this one as duplicate
WorkItem.Description:
Seems like the unique check for Nightmare Tears is broken in 2.3.3, at least partly.
If I use the optimizer, everything is ok. But the comparison list shows items with a Nightmare Tear if I already have one equipped. And it even shows items with multiple Nightmare Tears in one item.
Â 
Yes, "Enforce Gem Requirements" is checked.
WorkItem.Summary: [Base] Unique check for Nightmare Tear not working

Comments.Message: I've seen this occasionally, where it'll get in a state that mistakenly allows multiple Nightmare Tears, but just swapping an item somewhere seems to fix it. It's been really hard for me to reproduce reliably. If anyone can provide exact repro steps, please do.

Oh, you are right. I can't reproduce it anymore now.
I'll report back if I find a way to reproduce it.

If you do get a specific build set that reproduces the error save the file and attach the XML here. This means we can load the file and fix the bug. Numerous people have reported it but no-one has actually bothered to save the XML file so we can reproduce the problem.

I don't think it depends on the items (or anything else in the XML).
Because I haven't changed anything in my XML since I saw the bug, but can't find a way to reproduce it again with the same XML.
